newsitem.title: USA: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post front - May 23.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Washington Post front - May 23.

text.p: The Washington Post carried the following items on its front page on May 23:
WASHINGTON - Lt. Kelly Flinn agreed to resign without an honorable discharge to avoid a court-martial over an adulterous affair.
DENVER, Colorado - Attorneys for Oklahoma City bombing defendant Timothy McVeigh opened their defence with testimony suggesting that a mystery bomber may have died in the April 19, 1995 explosion.
WASHINGTON - Police arrested an Indian immigrant and the owner of a neighbourhood bar in Arlington, Virginia, for allegedly stealing a winning lottery ticket from a customer.
WASHINGTON - The United States has imposed economic sanctions on two Chinese companies and five Chinese citizens for selling chemicals and chemical production equipment to Iran.
MOSCOW - President Boris Yeltsin fired his defence minister and the chief of his general staff, and issued a blistering attack on the military high command.

WASHINGTON - A Rockville man was indicted on charges of manslaughter and driving while intoxicated, even though his teenage son was driving their car -- without a learner's permit or driver's licence -- when it swerved into the path of a world-class triathlete.
